subject: Remedial
title: Stonehill vs. Diokno (G.R. No. L-19550)
ratio: The Exclusionary Rule: Evidence obtained through an illegal search and seizure is inadmissible for any purpose in any proceeding. It is the 'Fruit of the Poisonous Tree'.

subject: Remedial
title: Neypes vs. CA (G.R. No. 141524)
ratio: The 'Fresh Period Rule': A party has a fresh period of 15 days from the denial of a Motion for Reconsideration to file a Notice of Appeal.

subject: Remedial
title: Cagang vs. Sandiganbayan (G.R. No. 206438)
ratio: Inordinate Delay: The clock for determining a violation of the Right to Speedy Disposition of Cases begins from the fact-finding stage/preliminary investigation.

subject: Remedial
title: Doctrine of Hierarchy of Courts
ratio: Direct recourse to the Supreme Court is discouraged. Petitions must be filed first with the lowest court having concurrent jurisdiction, save for special and important reasons.

subject: Remedial
title: Transcendental Importance Doctrine
ratio: The Court may brush aside procedural technicalities (like Locus Standi) when the issues involved are of paramount public interest and transcendental importance.
